intro: Psychotria everardii subsp. sipapoensis, commonly known as the Sipapoensis Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth layers of tropical forests. The plant is also notable for its chemical composition, containing alkaloids that have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
